# Erase (Spell)
## Overview
[[Transmutation Spells|Transmutation]]

**Level:** [[1st Level Bard Spells|Bard 1]], [[1st Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 1]], [[1st Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 1]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 1st-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 1]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S

**Range:** Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)

**Target:** One scroll or two pages

**Duration:** Instantaneous

**Saving Throw:** See text

**Spell Resistance:** No

**Source:** PF Core Rulebook, pg. 279

*Erase* removes writings of either magical or mundane nature from a scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces. With this spell, you can remove *[[Explosive Runes (Spell)|explosive runes]]**,* a *[[Glyph of Warding (Spell)|glyph of warding]]**,* a *[[Sepia Snake Sigil (Spell)|sepia snake sigil]]**,* or an *[[Arcane Mark (Spell)|arcane mark]]*, but not *[[Illusory Script (Spell)|illusory script]]* or a *symbol* spell. Nonmagical writing is automatically erased if you touch it and no one else is holding it. Otherwise, the chance of erasing nonmagical writing is 90%.

Magic writing must be touched to be erased, and you also must succeed on a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against DC 15. A natural 1 is always a failure on this check. If you fail to erase *[[Explosive Runes (Spell)|explosive runes]]*, a *[[Glyph of Warding (Spell)|glyph of warding]]*, or a *[[Sepia Snake Sigil (Spell)|sepia snake sigil]]*, you accidentally activate that writing instead.
